title: Simple but significant improvements to command-loading error handling.

labels.name: robustness
labels.description: Enhancements to reduce fragility under different conditions.

body:
* Improvements to wording of function documentation in addition to changes required to accommodate implementation changes.
* New exceptions `spack.cmd.PythonNameError` and `spack.cmd.CommandNameError`.
* New functions `spack.cmd.require_python_name(pname)` and `spack.cmd.require_cmd_name(cname)` check that `pname` and `cname` respectively meet requirements, throwing the appropriate error if not.
* `spack.cmd.get_module()` uses `require_cmd_name()` and passes through exceptions from module load attempts.
* `spack.cmd.get_command()` uses `require_cmd_name()` and invokes `get_module()` with the correct command-name form rather than the previous (incorrect) Python name.
* New exceptions `spack.extensions.CommandNotFoundError` and `spack.extensions.ExtensionNamingError`.
* `_extension_regexp` has a new leading underscore to indicate expected privacy.
* `spack.extensions.extension_name()` raises an `ExtensionNamingError` rather than using `tty.warn()`.
* `spack.extensions.load_command_extension()` checks command source existence early and bails out if missing. Also, exceptions raised by `load_module_from_file()` are passed through.
* `spack.extensions.get_module()` raises `CommandNotFoundError` as appropriate.
* Spack `main()` allows `parser.add_command()` exceptions to cause program end.
* Extension commands containing hyphens are now dealt with correctly: command `spack hyphenated-cmd` should be implemented in (say) `.../spack-myext/myext/cmd/hyphenated_cmd.py` and define a function `hyphenated_cmd()`). Previously it would be found only in `hyphenated-cmd.py`, in contrast to hyphenated internal commands and standard Python import conventions.
* Extension names containing hyphens are now dealt with correctly: for an extension with name (per `spack test --extension <name>`) `hyphenated-ext`, the directory structure should be `.../spack-hyphenated-ext/hyphenated_ext/cmd/...`. Absolute imports should be in the form `import spack.extensions.hyphenated_ext...`.

Tests:

* More common boilerplate has been pulled out into fixtures including `sys.modules` dictionary cleanup, creation of the full (correct) directory structure for an extension, and resource-managed creation of extension commands with specified contents in the source file.
* "Hello, World!" test now uses a command named `hello-world` instead of `hello` in order to verify correct handling of commands with hyphens.
* New tests for:
  * Missing or misnamed command.
  * Missing or misnamed command function in a command module.
  * Badly-named extension.
  * Verification that errors encountered during import of a command are propagated upward.
  * Ability to invoke a command multiple times.
  * Correct handling of hyphenated extension names (with appropriate directory structure), including import of module code and invocation of commands.
  * Correct handling of the case where the desired command is found elsewhere than in the first-configured extension.
